result.execSummary:
The defendant Shykela K Staples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
$250.00 BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Attend the Criminal Thinking course-retail theft.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - With Huber. Court grants 10 days credit. Sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee County with NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shykela K Staples

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-29-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Shykela K Staples in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 12-14-2015 02:00 pm

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court.   Defendant Shykela K Staples did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as her client is out of state. State has no objections to adjournment. Court grants. Court issues a capias, but STAYED that capias.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Shykela K Staples in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a short adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
